While smoke testing 20080208 build, I noticed several "Refreshing Local" informational messages in the error log.  A sub-status indicates an error:

org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.ResourceException: The resource tree is locked for modifications.
at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.WorkManager.checkIn(WorkManager.java:94)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.prepareOperation(Workspace.java:1690)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.refreshLocal(Resource.java:1398)
at org.eclipse.jst.jsf.common.ui.internal.utils.WorkspaceUtil.getProjectFor(WorkspaceUtil.java:189)
at org.eclipse.jst.jsf.common.ui.internal.utils.WebrootUtil.getWebPath(WebrootUtil.java:49)
at org.eclipse.jst.jsf.facesconfig.ui.pageflow.PageflowEditor.webPageChanged(PageflowEditor.java:1182)
at org.eclipse.jst.jsf.facesconfig.ui.pageflow.PageflowEditor$ResourceTracker.visit(PageflowEditor.java:248)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.ResourceDelta.accept(ResourceDelta.java:67)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.ResourceDelta.accept(ResourceDelta.java:76)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.ResourceDelta.accept(ResourceDelta.java:76)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.ResourceDelta.accept(ResourceDelta.java:76)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.ResourceDelta.accept(ResourceDelta.java:48)
at org.eclipse.jst.jsf.facesconfig.ui.pageflow.PageflowEditor$ResourceTracker.resourceChanged(PageflowEditor.java:224)
...

I was modifying the faces-config nav rules with the Tomcat server running and executing the app.

This issue is not new.  It is more apparent now because I changed the way the problem is logged.  It arises because refresh is being called on the navigator from within a workspace change event listener.  During such change events, the navigator's perhaps checks (effectively locks itself) to avoid infinite recursion. 

The problem, while definitely in need of remedy, does not appear to be a serious issue at this time which is why the severity is info.

re-open if you think these are different issues

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 180020 ***
